reviews.review: Portal 2 is literally one of the most polished, detailed, and most well written games I’ve ever played. Even a decade later it’s still more fun and more cleverly designed than many modern games, and it’s a true testiment to how amazing Valve can be when they actually give a crap. The small details of random panels jerking and attempting to fold back into place make it truly feel like a run down testing facility, and the dialogue is more funny and entertaining than most shows I’ve watched. Despite there only being a few characters, they all have loads of personality (excluding Chell), and even the mostly mute Peabody and Atlas are filled to the brim with character. The story is super cool, and perfectly bounces off of the story of the first game. I could spend paragraphs and paragraphs describing the excellency of this game, but it speaks for itself. This game is a must buy no matter the price, which is even better considering how cheap the game is. This is one of the few games that I’d give a proper 11/11 chunks of pure marble.

so, I managed to fix the game's audio bug, however it needs to be done every other time you open the game. you open the console, and type "snd_rebuildaudiocache". you then wait a while, then sign out of your computer, DO NOT SHUT DOWN. you will then log back in, and open the game. it SHOULD then be fixed.
now, if you don't know what the "console" that I'm talking about is, you need to go into the "options" tab in the game, "go into the "keyboard" tab, then look for an option I believe to be labeled "developer console". it is automatically set to disabled. enable it, then type the command I listed above, and follow the listed instructions, and that SHOULD be it.
Other than this audio issue, the game is great.

Oh My GOD, I have no words. I LOVE this game so much, the story is amazing! The Co-Op is amazingly executed, and the limitless potential of the Perpetual Testing Initiative is so much fun! If you loved the original Portal, this one is SO much better!

The Industrial Revolution and its consequences have
been a disaster for the human race. They have greatly
increased the life-expectancy of those of us who live in
“advanced” countries, but they have destabilized society,
have made life unfulfilling, have subjected human beings
to indignities, have led to widespread psychological suffering (in the Third World to physical suffering as well) and
have inflicted severe damage on the natural world.

The most approachable FPS ever made.  To top it off, it may be one of the best games ever made. The additional mechanics such as the gel and light bridges/tunnels are seamlessly added.  I feel very few games will stand the test of time as well as the Portal series.
Lots of nostalgic memories, playing this game when I was but a wee lad. One of Valve’s best.

Masterpiece. What else is there to say? Perfect conclusion for the story with new challenging levels to solve. And if that is not enough you can always try new levels from steam workshop. And do you know what is even better? You can do all of this with your friend in co-op as well!

So, what are you waiting for? Price for this game can go all the way down to 2€ during the sales! You won't be able to find better value anywhere on Steam!

CARAMBA, QUE JOGO CANSATIVO.
  Portal 2 é em todos os aspectos melhor que o Portal 1, sem dúvidas. Cenários maiores, novos artifícios de puzzle, história mais desenvolvida e por aí vai. Por mais que você encontre detonados de 3 horas, eu demorei 8 horas pra zerar (o resto do meu tempo foi no coop) pq em certos trechos o jogo exige um pouco mais do seu raciocínio, então é bom jogar dando umas pausas (eu zerei o jogo em 3 dias, mas isso vai de cada um).
  No final, somando toda a diversão e qualidade técnica do jogo, eu diria que ele é nota 9.5/10 (só tirei ponto pq achei ele um pouco maior doq deveria)
muy bueno very good jeje salu2
Классная игра. Поиграл 10 часов с другом и забыл на месяц, но так- игра крутая

I’m gonna voice the unpopular opinion here and say the original game was better. Obviously, it was cheaper. If you just care about puzzles, then get both this game and the original. But if you care about atmosphere and ambience, this game is a big step down. For me, a big element in making Portal what it was was the mysterious, silent, and slightly creepy environment in which you worked in. Cameras watching your every move, but never a soul behind those glazed windows. Occasionally a sign of something being off. A panel was removed, revealing a crawl space where it appeared some deranged person had been living. They also used the ambience found in Ravenholm. Portal two may have some similar looking environments…but now they’re spoiled by Glados, wheatley, or Johnson yelling over the intercom and jabbering constantly. Nevermind the obnoxious and ham fisted cake and companion cube references. Less can be more, and this game is proof of that.
One of the greatest games I’ve played on PC. Story is amazing and I would love to play this for the first time again.

Портал 2 в кооперативе - это когда 10 минут тупишь и не понимаешь как открыть дверь, а потом подходишь к ней, а у неё рычаг есть.
- это когда ты кидаешь в портал к другу турель и закрываешь портал.
- это когда тебе Гладос даёт очки Уважения+ за убийство своего друга.
- это когда взорвать, разобрать и собрать тебя быстрее ,чем просто подняться на верх.
- это когда ты теряешь 5000 Уважения+ от Гладос за то, что помахал ручкой.
- это когда тебя постоянно сжимает в тисках твой собственный же друг.
- это когда ты забываешь, что через порталы можно ходить, и стоишь смотришь через портал на место куда тебе надо попасть и думаешь как тебе туда попасть.

One of my best adventures in the videogame world.
The game is just overwhelmingly good, no wonder it's considered a piece of art.
The place that was the old laboratory now was the huge facility turned onto chaos and destruction.
The voicelines, the music, the choice of colors... everything.
One of the games you must play in order to consider you a gamer.

I love this game so much. I think it was my first real video game, and it's still so much fun after all these years. You can play by yourself on a fully developed single player, and with a friend on a just as developed co-op mode. The game also has a great modding community and has hundreds of custom maps that can add just as many hours to your play time. With all this in mind, I give Portal 2 a 10/10.

“All right, I've been thinking, when life gives you lemons, don't make lemonade! Make life take the lemons back! Get mad! I don't want your damn lemons! What am I supposed to do with these? Demand to see life's manager!
Make life rue the day it thought it could give Cave Johnson lemons! Do you know who I am? I'm the man whose gonna burn your house down with the lemons!” - Cave Johnson
